class_c_05_history_01:
Greetings, my little students. Whatever you did
yesterday, it is now a part of history.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_02:
I was hoping to continue unraveling the marvels
that history has presented to us today.\c
However, I imagine your ability to concentrate
has been spectacularly derailed by my midterm.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_03:
I suppose changing things up for fun and variety
may be a good idea every now and then.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_04:
So allow me to tell you an old fairy tale that has
been passed down in Paldea for generations.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_05:
Once upon a time, there was a king who very
much enjoyed collecting treasure.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_06:
He was particularly fond of treasures from
other countries.\c
One day, a merchant from the East heard rumors
of this king and came to meet him.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_07:
The merchant laid out four treasures in front of
the treasure-loving king.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_08:
The four treasures were as follows: a vessel, a
sword, a set of tablets, and a set of beads.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_09:
Seeing such rarities before him, the king leaped
for joy.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_10:
He showered the merchant with gold coins and
claimed all four of the treasures for himself.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_11:
Aha. Perfect timing to make eye contact, young
[VAR TRNAME(0000)]. Answer me this...[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_12:
I said that one of the treasures was a “set of
tablets.” What do you think these tablets were?[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_answer_01:
Correct! Your daily pursuit of knowledge serves
you well.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_answer_02:
Incorrect! Is that some kind of joke? Were you
expecting me to laugh at your assumption that\r
electronic tablets existed in the distant past?[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_answer_03:
Incorrect! Is that some kind of joke? Were you
expecting me to laugh at the notion that\r
chewable tablets would be considered treasure?[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_13:
These particular tablets were wooden and used
as a writing medium in the East in ancient times.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_14:
As you may know, they fell out of popular use
as paper become more universally available.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_15:
For the king to consider these paper substitutes
treasures, they must have been of superb quality.\c
That, or perhaps they had some amazingly
profound teachings written on them.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_16:
So, the king obtained these four treasures, and
on that very night...[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_17:
it is said that a terrible disaster rained down upon
his castle, reducing it to rubble by dawn.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_18:
Oho, is that the time already? I wasn’t done with
my story, but alas. So ends today’s lesson.[VAR 0114(0027)]
class_c_05_history_19:
If you are interested in how the story ends,
you may come see me outside class hours.[VAR 0114(0027)]
